skillTree.localised_description: Pugnacious and stubborn, the war beasts that pull these ramshackle chariots are grotesque combinations of great boar and mighty ram.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can deploy outside the deployment zone.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
This unit can pass through trees.

enabled_if: Leadership is higher than 50% of base

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

skillTree.localised_description: A deadly mountain of muscle and hair, forced to pull its Beastlord’s chariot, is a truly repulsive proposition indeed.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
This unit can pass through trees.

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

skillTree.localised_description: Even when not feasting, the Beastmen taste blood on their lips, smell it on their fur, and want for more.
This Lord speaks with a dread booming voice – a gift from his Dark Masters to ensure obedience.
A palpable miasma of fell sorcery surrounds the Bray-Shaman, distorting and maiming reality.
Shamans do not generally engage in physical combat themselves, instead sending out their spirit to possess a suitably monstrous surrogate.
Bray-Shamans speak the will of the Dark Gods, and those that defy them pay the highest price of all.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -10% for all spells

Winds of Magic cost: +15% for all enemy spells
	(enemy armies in local province)

skillTree.localised_description: He knows. Nobody knows how, but he does. He has always just known.
Chaos smiles upon them, granting unnatural and heretical defence against mortal machinations.
Who wants to live forever? As it turns out, most beings wouldn't say no…

effects.description: This Lord will be wounded instead of killed in battle

skillTree.localised_description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Impenetrably matted fur and grim trinkets make the Bray-Shamans more than just vile to behold, but incredibly hard to injure.
By the Bray-Shaman’s incantations, those lesser in body or mind have their hair and fur clogged into impervious hides.

effects.description:
Armour: +10 for Chaos Warhounds, Harpies, Razorgor Herd, Chaos Spawn, Giant, Jabberslythe, Ghorgon, Cygor, and Manticore units
	(all units in army)

skillTree.localised_description: In the right hands the braystaff is not just a symbol of position or conduit of magic, but also a brutal weapon.
In frenzied ritual celebration the Bray-Shaman invokes the Dark Gods’ power to infuse the herds with bestial strength.

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +8% for Chaos Warhounds, Harpies, Razorgor Herd, Chaos Spawn, Giant, Jabberslythe, Ghorgon, Cygor and Manticore units
	(all units in army)

skillTree.localised_name: Desecrators of the nations of men
skillTree.localised_description: While other Beastmen can focus on slaughter and cruelty just for the sake of it, shamans never forget that their only purpose must be the total destruction of the civilized world

effects.description:
Weapon Strength: +6% when fighting against Order factions

	(Lord's army)

Morale: +10 when fighting against the factions of Order

skillTree.localised_description: Even before the siege begins, a shaman will summon the most disgusting creatures of the dirt and mud to plague and rot the supplies of the enemy.

skillTree.localised_description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.
A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5

skillTree.localised_description: When everything else fails, there is always studying the blade. (This skill can accept up to 20 Skill Points)
Wielding the shield is better than returning on it. (This skill can accept up to 20 Skill Points)
The great green orb hangs ominously in the sky above, its followers driven to acts of madness and depravity.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Beastmen abhor humanitity above all things, but some Bray-herd shamans learn their tactics in order to overcome them. Or even use them if the situation demands it

skillTree.localised_description: Shamans, wielder of powerful magics as they are, appreciate the chance to kill some enemies before they can even know they are under attack

skillTree.localised_description: No beast can truly be controlled, but these desperate contrivances bring the smallest semblance of order.

skillTree.localised_description: The whimsical nature of the Dark Gods means that those blessed with their gifts are surely fated to greatness... or to the greatest fall.”

skillTree.localised_description: No matter the height of its walls or the centuries and lives spent in their construction; whatever men build, Beastmen can destroy.

effects.description:
Missile Damage: +3% for Cygor units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon Strength: +3% for Cygor, Incarnate Elemental of Beasts, Giant, Jabberslythe, and Ghorgon units
	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "We feel it. We all feel it. The pull to war. The tug of battle. The NEED to kill."
The Beastman delights in constant fighting; in vicious, ceaseless brutality. It gives him purpose.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +5 for Ungor Spearmen Herd, Ungor Herd, Gor Herd, Tzaangors, Pestigors, Khorngors and Bestigor Herd units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +5 for Ungor Spearmen Herd, Ungor Herd, Gor Herd, Tzaangors, Pestigors, Khorngors and Bestigor Herd units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The Beastmen’s elite menagerie – the brayherds – slaughter all those caught in their savage, animalistic sights.

effects.description:
Speed: +10% for Centigors, Centigors (Great Weapons), Centigors of Tzeentch, Razorgor Herd, Razorgor Chariot, Tuskgor Chariot, Chaos Warhounds, Feral Manticore and Harpies units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Only a select few from a herd gain their Beastlord's acknowledgement – a prize earned through the carnage and chaos they spread in battle.

effects.description:
Missile resistance: 15% for Chaos Spawn, Minotaurs, Giant, Jabberslythe, Incarnate Elemental of Beasts and Ghorgon units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The stench of magic is palpable. No mage can stand in the midst of battle against the baying warherds.

effects.description:
Missile strength: +10% for Ungor Raiders, Centigors (Throwing Axes) and Cygor units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Reload time reduction: +10% for Ungor Raiders, Centigors (Throwing Axes), and Cygor units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Spell resistance: 15% for Ungor Raiders, Centigors (Throwing Axes), and Cygor units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: In fitful dreams, he sees the end. The world collapsing in on itself, leaving nothing but ashes and aberration.
The ground shakes. The earth moves. The spirit trembles. The Beastman comes.
For those who face the warherd, a fate worse than death awaits their salivating jaws and unremitting bloodlust.
Unknowingly, the Beastmen serve their dark and Ruinous Gods, who in turn bless their every action.

effects.description: Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +10%
Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +20%
Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +30%

skillTree.localised_description: A pungent mix of fell unguents ensures the unholy vitality of one’s minions.

effects.description:
Attrition: -10% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -20% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -30% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "This stinking mortal Hold will fall, my masters have foreseen it. Bring them ruin!"

effects.description:
Attrition suffered by defender: +5% when laying siege or encircling
	(local region)

Attrition suffered by defender: +10% when laying siege or encircling
	(local region)

Attrition suffered by defender: +15% when laying siege or encircling
	(local region)

skillTree.localised_description: This willing servant of the Ruinous Powers has a resilience that is beyond any mortal measure.

effects.description:
Casualty replenishment rate: +30% for this Lord
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: With the servants of Chaos comes the corruption - as the landscape twists, this one speeds the transformation.

effects.description: Magic item drop chance from battle: +5%
Magic item drop chance from battle: +10%
Magic item drop chance from battle: +15%

skillTree.localised_description: When the warherd gathers, there is much feasting, debauchery, and revelling in mania and depravity.
Brought into this world by the cataclysm of Chaos, Beastmen are the very image of a dread future.

effects.description: Chance of intercepting an army using Tunnelling, beast-paths or Worldroots: +10%
Chance of intercepting an army using Tunnelling, beast-paths or Worldroots: +5%
Chance of intercepting an army using Tunnelling, beast-paths or Worldroots: +10%

skillTree.localised_description: They bray beneath the weird, green moon, and do their perverse, grim butchery in the name of the heretical Gods.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
This unit can pass through trees.

enabled_if: Leadership is higher than 50% of base

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Some beings just don't know when to put the bottle down.

attributes.bullet_text: Even when performing the most fatiguing actions, this unit never loses vigour.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: More than mere bloodlust, this one is filled with the primal, Ruinous rage of the Lord of Battle.

enabled_if: Leadership is higher than 50% of base

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

backgroundSkills.localised_description: This one has something of the compost heap about them…
The Dark Tongue is an apt medium through which to torment, mock and enrage the foe.
Sometimes, letting so much blood that the soil itself is stained just isn't enough. And it will never be.

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +8% for Minotaur units
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Deceit is a perfectly acceptable means of attack.

effects.description:
Ambush success chance: +10%
	(armies in local owned region)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Having a modicum of resolve is useful in a world that continually tests it.

related_attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Self-belief is a fine thing when not misplaced.
Always in control, this one leaves no stone unturned and nothing to chance.
Although actually reading minds is not in their skillset, this one has extraordinary insight into the motives of others.

effects.description: Magic item drop chance from battle: +15%

backgroundSkills.localised_description: If you're gonna die, you may as well die with your boots on.
Rugged, resistant, and almost unbreakable, this being can and will take on all comers.
If you can swing, slash, stab, gouge, or shoot it, this warrior has mastered every aspect of its use.
This being has a plan - not just a game plan, but a master plan to achieve their long-term aims.
Careful planning, knowledge of the terrain and the weaknesses of the enemy are the key to victory.

target_if: Not on or below a platform
